overview.note: "On Tuesday a joint election of both houses of the legislature of this state, for state treasurer took place... -- Carey's Diary." Aurora. General Advertiser (Philadelphia, PA). January 18, 1800.
"Yesterday both Houses of the Pennsylvania Legislature proceeded to the choice of a State Treasurer for the term of one year." Lancaster Journal (Lancaster, PA). January 15, 1800.

sub_unit.name: House of Representatives
sub_unit.note: Members of the House of Representatives voting for Peter Baynton were "Messrs. Barclay, Blair, Brown, Buckley, Bull, Cobean, Campbell, Dunlop, Erwin, Fisher, Fox, Franklin, Frazer, Haga, Hall, Hannum, Hemphill, Herbach, Keys, Hopkins, Hunter, Keppele, Kirk, MacNair, Royer, MacPherson, Mifflin, Miller, Palmer, Preston, Sample, A. Scott, J. Scott, Stewart, Strickler, Stover, Taylor, Turner, Wynkoop." Lancaster Journal (Lancaster, PA). January 15, 1800.

Members of the House of Representatives voting for Jacob Carpenter were "Messrs. Weaver, Alter, Barnet, Beale, Boileau, Conrad, Coolbach, Cunningham, Davis, Eyre, Folmer, Frailey, Harris, Hartzel, Hostetter, Ingels, Ley, Linnard, Logan, Lyle, MacDowel, Mitchel, Painter, Penrose, Potts, Roberts, Rose, Rugh, Shoemaker, Smith, Snyder, Udree, Urie, Van Horne, Whitehill, Wilson (Dauphin), Wilson, (Northampton) and Witman." Lancaster Journal (Lancaster, PA). January 15, 1800.

sub_unit.name: State Senate
sub_unit.note: Senators voting for Peter Baynton were "Messrs. Woods, Barton, Carpenter, Chapman, Ewing, Gurney, Jones, Newlin, Potts, MacClellan, Whelen, Postlethwaite, Smith, King, and Johnston." Lancaster Journal (Lancaster, PA). January 15, 1800.
Senators voting for Jacob Carpenter were "Messrs. Dale, Findley, Hamilton, Kean, Lower, Maclay, Say, Stewart, and Mewhorter." Lancaster Journal (Lancaster, PA). January 15, 1800.
